results.title: Captains, barges and canals
results.brief_description: A lighthearted presentation of Germany’s inland waterways. Barges provide the cheapest form of transport, and carry one third of Germany’s goods. Follows the barges and their families on the highways and byways of the canals, showing the surrounding country-side; the many types of barges; the traffic problems; slow operating lochs, and customs and police inspections. No other credits available.

results.title: Captain Noah and his floating zoo
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove, Bridget Appleby, Douglas Terry, Peter Clark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: The story of Noah and his Ark, told in words, animation and music. God had created a world and set mankind on it, but when He looked down on His people He saw only sinning and selfishness. But He found Noah, the only good man left, living outside the walls of Fun City, and told him in a dream what He was going to do. Music by Joseph Horovitz and lyrics by Michael Flanders.

results.title: Captain Cook safari
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service and General Motors Holden
results.brief_description: General Motors Holden’s trial drivers and a Brisbane T.V. team travel from Brisbane to Cooktown in four new production model vehicles, to commemorate the bi-centenary of Captain Cook’s 100 days on the Queensland coast. They visit the points where Captain Cook’s expedition landed in 1770. Shows the different terrain and driving conditions in route. Narrated by Geoff Raymond and photographed by Ken Jacoby.

results.title: Caps for sale [B&W]
results.brief_description: This is a charming tale about a peddler whose stolen caps mean all kinds of monkey business. Whimsical illustrations and flighty trills of music reflect the storyteller’s words. Based on the book written and illustrated by Esphyr Slobodkina. Narrated by Esphyr Slobodkina.

results.title: Le Capitaine H
results.brief_description: We follow the “Genevilliers”, a petrol barge, along the River Seine from the throbbing harbour to the mellow arches of Paris. Life bounded by the ever-changing banks has its own special kind of freedom. Captain Michael hacke and his family see the river in different weathers, colors and moods. They feel a unique brotherhood with their fellow river dwellers, a chance meeting with relatives is an occasion for celebration. No matter how the life of a bargee may change with time, the river remains a world unto itself. Commentary in English. Photography by Roger Fellous and jean-Jacques Languepin. Music by Jean Wiener.

results.title: Capitalism and communism: a comparison
results.brief_description: This film compares communism at work in a town in Yugoslavia and capitalism in a comparable town in the United States, and discusses the strengths and weaknesses of each economic system, taken from the points of view of practitioners of each system. Includes brief footage of pre-communist Russia.

results.title: Capital county
results.creator_credit: Cecil Musk and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: An account of the growth of the London County Council and a survey of its present day (1950’s) operations. The first part of the film deals with the rapid expansion of the city during the 19th century, pointing out this situation eventually necessitated the amalgamation of many local authorities into one body. Contrasts present day handling of London County Council services with that of the 19th century. Scenes at an LCC election emphasize that ballot is secret and that is is possible for any Londoner to become a Councillor.

results.title: Capital Circle: Canberra
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Capital Circle was designed to disperse traffic flows and to protect the Parliamentary Triangle. This film is a record of the planning and construction of the inner and outer rings, viaducts, cuttings and road works around Capital Hill in Canberra, built to facilitate traffic flow between the Woden Valley and Canberra City.

results.title: Special Project no. 14: Marlo-Mallacoota-Cape Conran
results.brief_description: The Country Roads Board’s Project no. 14 involves the building of a road from Orbost to Marlo. Shows the first section to Cape Conran and difficulties encountered in clearing and leveling the sandy loam. The area opened by the road has great development potential in its attractive surf beaches, bushland and off-shore oil drilling. Photography by Jim Stirling.
